description: M Tech full form is Master of Technology , a PG degree course in engineering and technology with a duration of 2 years. With a bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline, you can opt for an MTech course to learn advanced technical knowledge and research experience in a particular domain for better earning opportunities and salary potential.

MTech courses strongly focus on research, originality, and an analytical approach. M Tech courses are offered as Regular, Sponsored, Part-Time MTech (For Working Professionals), and Online MTech courses. There are more than 3,000 MTech colleges in India, including government and private.

MTech courses are offered in specializations, including AI & ML, Data Science, Robotics Engineering, Civil Engineering , Mechanical Engineering , and so on. You can continue reading the article for more details on M Tech courses in India.

M.Tech full form is Master of Technology, which is a PG degree offering specialized knowledge and expertise in a specific field of engineering and technology. You can refer to the table below, highlighting some key points of the MTech courses in India .
Note - The information is taken from external sites and may vary.

Entry-Level Roles : Computer Programmer, Software Developer, IT Consultant, Electrical Engineer, Mechanical Engineer, etc. Specialized Roles : IoT Engineer, Cloud Solutions Architect, Data Scientist, Cybersecurity Specialist, Mechatronics Engineer, etc. Mid-Level Positions : Data Analyst, Database Administrator, Network Systems Administrator, etc. Senior and Leadership Roles : Product Team Lead, Project Manager, Research Scientist, AI/ML Engineer, etc.
Google, Apple, Microsoft, Qualcomm, EXL, Amazon, ICICI, etc.

rows.M Tech Eligibility Criteria: Students must have completed B.E. (Bachelor of Engineering) or B.Tech (Bachelor of Technology) in a relevant engineering discipline from a recognized university.
Generally, 55-60% marks in B.E./B.Tech (may vary by university/chosen specialization).
SC/ST/OBC/PwD candidates often have a relaxation of 5% in the minimum marks percentage.

GATE (Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering) is the most common entrance exam for M.Tech admission. Other exams include CUET PG, CEETA PG, AP PGECET, and TS PGECET. Admission is based on the rank obtained in the entrance test conducted for MTech courses.

eligibility_admission.text: Eligibility Criteria for Integrated MTech + PhD Courses

rows.Eligibility Criteria: Students must have completed B.E. or B.Tech. in a relevant engineering discipline from a recognized university.
Generally, 55-60% marks in B.E./B.Tech (may vary by university/chosen specialization).
SC/ST/OBC/PwD candidates often have a relaxation of 5% in the minimum marks percentage.

GATE (Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering) is the primary entrance exam for MTech + PhD admission. Some top colleges may conduct their own exams for admission or accept scores like Karnataka PGCET, OJEE, CSIR UGC NET, etc. Admission is based on rank and marks obtained in the entrance test.

rows.Details: Have a look at the MTech eligibility requirements for the desired college.
Fill out the college application forms before the last date.
Sit for the relevant MTech entrance exams and score excellent marks in the exam.
Attend interviews or skill-based assessment rounds.
Attend college counseling sessions meant for seat allotment based on entrance exam results.
Get hold of the final seat by paying the MTech fees and getting documents verified.

rows.MTech Scholarships & Awards: Half-Time Teaching Assistantship (HTTA) at a monthly stipend of INR 12,400 (for a maximum period of 22 months) for Indian Nationals, subject to institute rules. GATE-qualified candidates selected under the Department of Atomic Energy – Graduate Fellowship (DAE-GF) scheme will get a fellowship of INR 35,000 per month. Around three students will be selected from Mechanical Engineering (only in Design/ Nuclear/ Thermal Engineering) or Chemical Engineering, or from both, and will be awarded a monthly stipend under the Atomic Energy Regulatory Board Graduate Fellowship (AERB-GF) scheme.

Chancellor's Special Award (Best Outgoing Student), along with an endowment amount of INR 10,000. PG Indira Gandhi Scholarship for Single Girl Child PG Scholarship for University Rank Holders (I and II rank holders) worth INR 37,200. AICTE – GATE Scholarship for PG Students (MTech)

The Devarakonda Satyanarayana Award is given to a graduating female MTech student from the Geotechnical Engineering section of the Civil Engineering department at IIT Delhi, worth INR 25,000. Prof. Kasturi Lal Chopra Best MTech Thesis Award to recognize the talent whose exceptional MTech thesis is in the areas of Thin Films/ Nano-materials/ Quantum Materials/ Thin Film Solar Cells/ Thin film devices & applications. The award amount is INR 30,000. IIIE Cash Award is given to MTech students with the highest CGPA in the area of Industrial Engineering and Production Engineering in their final year, worth INR 25,000.

MTech students admitted based on the GATE exam scores are eligible to receive a scholarship of INR 12,400 every month from UGC. The Institute will apply for the GATE scholarship to UGC/MHRD. Further, they will receive a fee waiver from the Institute up to an amount of INR 60,500 per semester. The scholarship is provided instead of 6-8 hours of teaching assistantship work per week. For students admitted based on their score in the BITS HD Test or interviews conducted by BITS Pilani, they will receive a stipend of INR 13,400 per month for 6-8 hours of Teaching Assistantship work per week.

Scholarships based on Academic Merit (Both Graduation Percentage and CUCET Scores) Early Bird Scholarship (15% scholarship for CU graduates and 10% for graduates from other recognized universities who deposit the full semester fee at the time of admission.)

rows.Scholarships: Merit-based/ Free studentship (available for 25% of students who got admission) Notional prize (offered to 7% of admitted students) Indian Women's Association at Bonn scholarship
Institute Free Studentship (UG) Scholarship for SC/ ST/ PwD Students Scholarship for MSc students Donor Scholarship Scholarship for MTech, MS (Research) and MDes students
Smt. Kamala Sankhe Scholarship for girl student M. S. Patel Trust Merit-cum-Means Scholarship Smt. Parvathy Sitaram Merit-cum-Means Scholarship S.L. Venkiteswaran Merit-cum-Means Scholarship

btech_syllabus.text: The MTech course duration in India is 2 years. You can choose electives and core subjects related to your choice of specialisation. For detailed information on different specializations in M Tech Subjects and Syllabus , you can refer to the content below.

btech_salary_career.text: MTech Salary: Career Scope, Job Profiles & Top Recruiters

paragraphs: MTech or Master of Technology is a 2-year course which is gives a deeper knowledge in Engineering studies with specialisation. MTech degree is available in four different levels - full-time (regular), full-time (sponsored), part-time and project staff.
Candidates can see the table below:
Candidates can see the table below:

Fundamentals of Computer and Introduction to C programming
tables: Fundamentals of Computer and Introduction to C programming

paragraphs: Candidates can see the table below:
Candidates can see the table below:

MTech full form is a postgraduate engineering degree. It lays strong emphasis on advanced technical knowledge, research work, authenticity, and analytical aptitude. Its syllabus is planned out in a manner as to provide the students with advanced-level understanding in their chosen field of study and prepare them for promising earning opportunities in the job market via in-house lab sessions, industrial visits, and project work.

The MTech syllabus is well-rounded with the right combination of core M Tech subjects along with a plethora of interesting electives , hands-on training via lab work, research opportunities, technical skill development, and a final-year dissertation and project work .

You can read this article further to know everything about the MTech syllabus, specialization-wise subjects, popular books and authors, and download the syllabus PDFs of a few popular engineering colleges.

Every MTech specialization has different theoretical learning and practical experience. The following section covers the general subjects included in the MTech syllabus for a few of the popular specializations.

The M Tech Computer Science syllabus gives students a detailed understanding of the advanced aspects of computer systems programming, database management systems, algorithm design principles, computer networking applications, and data structures. See the following table.
Programming Laboratory II (for Elective V chosen)
Note - The information is taken from multiple sites and may vary.
Suggested Links for M Tech Subjects:

The M Tech Electrical Engineering subjects revolve around the concepts of Electromagnetism, Control Systems, Power System Analysis, Electricity Technology and Machines, Microprocessors, and Power Engineering. Check out the table below.
Electrical Engineering M Tech Subjects - Semester 1
Electrical Engineering M Tech Subjects - Semester 2
Electrical Engineering M Tech Subjects - Semester 3
Electrical Engineering M Tech Subjects - Semester 4
Note - The information is taken from multiple sites and may vary.

The M Tech in Mechanical Engineering syllabus deals with the advanced-level understanding of manufacturing processes, machine design, kinematics and dynamics of machines, engineering thermodynamics, fluid and solid mechanics, and CAD software. Refer to the following table.
Note - The information is taken from multiple sites and may vary.

Though the syllabus for the MTech Civil Engineering course would differ from one college to another, the general core subjects covered share some commonality. You can go through the basic M Tech Civil Engineering subjects as given in the table below for reference.
M Tech Civil Engineering Subjects – Semester 1
M Tech Civil Engineering Subjects – Semester 2
M Tech Civil Engineering Subjects – Semester 3
M Tech Civil Engineering Subjects – Semester 4
Note - The information is taken from multiple sites and may vary.

The MTech Electronics & Communication syllabus provides detailed knowledge to students about Advanced Digital Communication Systems, Nanoelectronics and Nano photonics, Advanced Wireless Communication Networks, VLSI Technology and Design, etc.
Note - The information is taken from multiple sites and may vary.

The MTech syllabus differs based on the specialization that is opted for by the students and the institute offering the course. The core M Tech subjects are compulsory for students to study in each semester; they provide a foundational base for some key engineering concepts. This section talks about a few basic core and elective subjects that are a part of the vast MTech syllabus.
You can see some of the core MTech subjects for a few popular engineering specializations in the table below.
Data Structure and Algorithms, Systems Programming and Operating Systems, Advanced Database Management System, VLSI Systems Design, etc.
Advanced Concrete Technology, Structural Dynamics, Rock Mechanics and Earth Pressure, Bridge Engineering, Earthquake Engineering, Solid Dynamics, etc.
Advanced Engineering Mathematics, Advanced Heat Transfer, Principles of Machining Process, Solid Mechanics and Fluid Dynamics, etc.
Advanced Power System Analysis, High Voltage Transmission System, Advanced Power System Protection, Power System Operation and Control, etc.
Advanced Microprocessor and Microcontrollers, Data Communication and Networking, Wireless and Optical Communication, Advanced Digital Signal Processing, etc.
Note - The information is taken from multiple sites and may vary.

Students have the opportunity to choose the elective subjects to study as per their interests and future plans, something they resonate with more and enjoy experimenting with. The MTech syllabus offers a plethora of elective subject choices to choose from. Some of the common and popular elective subjects in the MTech syllabus for a few popular specializations are given in the table below:
Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Computer Networks, Wireless Networks, Computer Vision, Internet of Things (IoT), Semantics of Programming Languages, etc.
Design of Industrial Structures, Structural Design and Detailing, Quality and Safety in Construction, Design of High Rise Buildings, Remote Sensing, etc.
Automotive Design, Mechatronic Product Design, Advanced Robotics, Machine Tool Design, Advanced Mechanisms, Plant Equipment Design, etc.
Power Quality and Conditioning, Electromechanical Devices & Systems, Advanced Power Electronics, Computer-Aided Design of Electrical Machines, etc.
Introduction to MEMS, Advanced Microwave Devices, CAD of VLSI Circuits, Digital IC Design, Microelectronics Chip Design, Semiconductor Optoelectronics, etc.
Note - The information is taken from multiple sites and may vary.

There are various recommended books for students planning to pursue MTech courses. These books are a reliable source of knowledge, providing insights into the subjects and their outline in a much more engaging way. Many of these books would be available in libraries, or the online versions of these books could also be downloaded and accessed by any student. A few of the common textbooks for popular MTech specializations are given below:
Verilog HDL: A Guide to Digital Design and Synthesis
An Integrated Approach to Computer Networks
Control in Robotics and Automation: Sensor Based Integration
B.K. Ghosh, T.J. Tarn, & Ning Xi
Note - The information is taken from multiple sites and may vary.

career_overview: M Tech full form is Master of Technology, a postgraduate degree in Engineering that serves as a doorway to careers in research and development organizations, manufacturing firms, IT and product-based companies, teaching, entrepreneurship, and various other sectors . On the basis of the MTech degree, entrepreneurs can easily get funds from venture capitalists. If one has a sound business sense along with great confidence, they can do wonders in their career.

For instance, students who pursue MTech in Electronics and Communication Engineering can get into fields like the VLSI or semiconductor industry, embedded systems, robotics, and communications industries . VLSI Design Engineers , who earn an average M Tech salary in India of INR 7 LPA to 15 LPA , are involved in making powerful processors with billions of transistors put together in a very small area to power the powerful things like Artificial Intelligence (AI). Top recruiters in this field include Intel, Nvidia, Qualcomm, Google, Apple, Microsoft, and Texas Instruments . The MTech degree is given a lot of value by chip design companies due to the in-depth knowledge it imparts.

Further, students with MTech degrees in Mechanical, ECE, or Mechatronics Engineering can work together to make robots. Robotics Engineers are also paid good salary packages ranging between INR 5 LPA and INR 8 LPA as they design, develop, and give a computer vision to robots via control systems for various uses in manufacturing, healthcare, and automation industries. ABB India, Fanuc India Pvt. Ltd., and Bosch India are some of the top recruiters.

Beyond these top profiles, MTech graduates can find rewarding careers in industries like communication systems , where they design and manage advanced networks for telecom companies and internet service providers; in artificial intelligence (AI), software, information technology, renewable energy , aerospace , etc. In general, some of the top job profiles for MTech courses graduates include Project Manager, Production Engineer, Research Associate, Software Developer, Technical Data Scientist, and many more. Top recruiters for M Tech courses are Google, Apple, Microsoft, Qualcomm, EXL, Amazon, ICICI, etc. The average annual M Tech salary in India for postgraduate students is around INR 7 LPA.

MTech Career Scope: Quick Facts: Design and develop complex integrated circuits (ICs) used in various electronic devices like smartphones, computers, and advanced electronics.
Develop sophisticated embedded systems for applications in consumer electronics, industrial automation, robotics, medical devices, and the Internet of Things (IoT).
Design, develop, program, and maintain robots for diverse applications in manufacturing, healthcare, automation, and logistics.
Analyze large datasets, build machine learning models, and extract insights to solve complex business problems across various industries.
Design, develop, optimize, and manage advanced communication networks for telecom companies, internet service providers, and other organizations.
Develop and implement AI algorithms for various applications like computer vision, natural language processing, and robotics.
Utilize advanced CAD software to design, analyze, and optimize complex engineering products and systems.
Analyze and manage heat transfer in various systems, ensuring optimal performance and efficiency.
Combine mechanical, electronic, and control systems engineering principles to design and develop intelligent machines and automated systems.
Apply engineering principles to plan, manage, and supervise construction projects, ensuring quality, safety, and adherence to budget and schedule.
Writes codes and builds software and networking applications using various programming languages and frameworks.
Manages a variety of projects from conception to completion, ensuring adherence to budget, schedule, and quality requirements.
Top Career Profiles in MTech: Design and develop complex integrated circuits (ICs) used in various electronic devices like smartphones, computers, and advanced electronics.
Develop sophisticated embedded systems for applications in consumer electronics, industrial automation, robotics, medical devices, and the Internet of Things (IoT).
Design, develop, program, and maintain robots for diverse applications in manufacturing, healthcare, automation, and logistics.
Analyze large datasets, build machine learning models, and extract insights to solve complex business problems across various industries.
Design, develop, optimize, and manage advanced communication networks for telecom companies, internet service providers, and other organizations.
Develop and implement AI algorithms for various applications like computer vision, natural language processing, and robotics.
Utilize advanced CAD software to design, analyze, and optimize complex engineering products and systems.
Analyze and manage heat transfer in various systems, ensuring optimal performance and efficiency.
Combine mechanical, electronic, and control systems engineering principles to design and develop intelligent machines and automated systems.
Apply engineering principles to plan, manage, and supervise construction projects, ensuring quality, safety, and adherence to budget and schedule.
Writes codes and builds software and networking applications using various programming languages and frameworks.
Manages a variety of projects from conception to completion, ensuring adherence to budget, schedule, and quality requirements.
Core Industries for MTech Careers in Ind: MTech graduates can easily make a move to the software industry and work in job roles like Software Developer, Computer Programmer, Mobile Application Developer, etc.

IT consulting jobs are quite valuable for their exceptional role in providing technology solutions to various organizations and helping them enhance their networking systems functionality. One can work as an IT Consultant, Technical Consultant, Software Advisor, etc.

Students can enter the ECE industry as the country is heading towards becoming a global hub for research and development in the domain of electronics and communication technologies. A few popular job profiles for MTech graduates are VLSI Design Engineer, Network Engineer, Embedded Systems Engineer, etc.

Students can work with various government agencies, research and development organizations, and PSUs. Some popular job roles include DRDO Scientist, ISRO Scientist or Engineer, NTPC Engineer, Railway Engineer, etc.

With an MTech degree in Aerospace Engineering, students can explore job roles like Aerospace Engineer, Aeronautical Engineer, Aviation Engineer, Propulsion Systems Engineer, Aerodynamics Engineer , etc.

MTech graduates can enter into the manufacturing industry where they would be responsible for designing and managing manufacturing processes, making sure they are cost-effective and efficient. Top profiles are Manufacturing Engineer, Quality Analyst, Supply-Chain Manager, etc.

JM Prepration.title: Why is Engineering Still a Highly Paid Career Stream?

intro.emphasis_text: Engineering as a career is very lucrative. Let us check why this is so and what makes engineering career so popular still today.
paragraphs: Engineering is still a highly paid career stream in India and worldwide because of simple phenomenon called “supply versus demand” . The relentless advancement of technology has fueled demand for engineers across industries. Against this, number of skilled professionals always falls short of demand, creating a competitive market that drives up salaries. Many other factors lead to sprouting of engineering careers that are very lucrative.

images.alt: Why Engineering is Still a Highly Paid Career Stream

intro.caption: Why Engineering is Still a Highly Paid Career Stream

paragraphs: To get into field of engineering , a student can start by selecting science or IT & software as their subject preference in higher education. Thereafter, they can apply for admission in top engineering colleges in India like IITs, NITs and IIITs. Apart from IITs, NITs and IIITs, many other colleges provide great engineering education, like BITS Pilani, VIT, Amrita University, SRMIST, Jadavpur University, and many more.

The degree that leads candidates to land a career in Engineering is BTech / BE . Further candidates can also pursue Master's with MTech / ME degree. The scope of research is also immense in engineering with a PhD in engineering.
Let's understand why engineering is so lucrative all over globe more than any other profession. Further, we will also discuss which engineering professions are most in demand and are highly paid.
There are several reasons why engineering is a highly paid career option, like:
Payscale is a trusted website that provides salary data from both traditional and nontraditional sources. As per Payscale, the top-paid engineering professions in India are as follows:
It is important to note that these are just average salaries, and actual salaries can vary depending on experience, skills, location, and company.

QA.description: Get insights from 11.2k questions on M.Tech, answered by students, alumni, and experts. You may also ask and answer any question you like about M.Tech

questions.question_text: What is the median package recorded during Jamia Hamdard M.Tech placements?

answers.answer_text: The median package recorded during Jamia Hamdard M.Tech placements 2024 was INR 6.2 LPA. In 2023 and 2022, M.Tech median package was 5.9 LPA and 4.3 LPA.

questions.question_text: How many students are placed during Jamia Hamdard M.Tech placements?

answers.answer_text: Students placed during Jamia Hamdard M.Tech placements in the past three years is mentioned below: Particulars MTech Placement Statistics 2022 MTech Placement Statistics 2023 MTech Placement Statistics 2024 Graduating students 45 25 60 Students placed 21 14 42 Students selected for higher studies 13 11 16

questions.question_text: Do I need a ME or M.Tech degree to be eligible for NIT Srinagar?

tags.tag_name: NIT Srinagar - National Institute of Technology

answers.answer_text: No, candidates who wish to apply for admissions to the NIT Srinagar PhD course are not required to cleared a ME or M.Tech course to be eligible. Candidates who have appeared for a MSc course in the relevant stream can also apply for PhD admissions. However, such candidates must appear for the GATE or UGC NET before applying for NIT Srinagar PhD admissions.

questions.question_text: Is a ME/MTech course required for NIT Jalandhar PhD admissions?

tags.tag_name: NIT Jalandhar: Placements, Admission 2024, Cut off, Courses, Fees, Ranking

answers.answer_text: Candidates who are applying for PhD courses from the engineering department such as NIT Jalandhar chemical engineering or NIT Jalandhar civil engineering departments must have a ME/MTech degree of the relevant field. However, NIT Jalandhar also offers PhD courses in Humanities, Science and Management sectors where, an ME/MTech degree is not required.

questions.question_text: Can we pursue M.Tech distance course at MAIET?

tags.tag_name: Maharishi Arvind Institute of Engineering and Technology

answers.answer_text: No, you cannot pursue M.Tech through distance education at MAIET. The mode of study for the offered course is full-time. If a course claims to be distance M.Tech then it's not AICTE recognised.

questions.question_text: What is the admission criteria for BRCM College of Engineering and Technology MTech?

tags.tag_name: BRCM College of Engineering and Technology

answers.answer_text: BRCM College of Engineering and Technology M.Tech admission criteria has to be fulfilled to get admission. The eligibility and selection requirements are as below: BRCM College of Engineering and Technology M.Tech eligibility - BTech with a minimum aggregate of 50% BRCM College of Engineering and Technology M.Tech selection process - GATE

questions.question_text: How many students are placed during IIT BHU M.Tech placements?

tags.tag_name: Indian Institute of Technology, BHU, Varanasi

answers.answer_text: As per NIRF report 2025, the number of students placed during M.Tech placements over the past three years is mentioned below: Particulars MTech Placement Statistics 2023 MTech Placement Statistics 2024 Graduating students 288 223 Students placed 258 188 Students selected for higher studies 26 30

questions.question_text: How are IIT BHU M.Tech placements?

tags.tag_name: Indian Institute of Technology, BHU, Varanasi

answers.answer_text: According to NIRF report 2025, M.Tech placement highlights 2025 are mentioned below: Particulars MTech Placement Statistics 2024 Median package INR 12 LPA Graduating students 223 Students placed 188 Students selected for higher studies 30

questions.question_text: Do I need to clear a BTech course to be eligible for IIIT Bhubaneshwar M.Tech admission?

answers.answer_text: No, BTech is not a mandatory UG level course to be eligible for IIIT Bhubaneshwar M.Tech admissions. Candidates who have cleared a BSc, BPharm, MCA, MSc or MA course in the right disciplines are also eligible to apply for M.Tech admissions at International Institute of Information Technology, Bhubaneswar.

questions.question_text: Can I apply for M.Tech admissions at IIIT Bhubaneshwar in offline mode?

answers.answer_text: International Institute of Information Technology, Bhubaneswar has not mentioned an offline mode of application for the M.Tech admissions. However, it is important to note here that the accepted entrance exam which is GATE, is not open for offline registrations. Candidates who are not applying for GATE or have received their scorecard will need to contact the admission desk of IIIT Bhubaneshwar.

questions.question_text: MBA from IIM or M.Tech. From IIT What you have to say?
questions.answer_text: An MBA from IIM is ideal if you aim for leadership, business, or management roles with high salary packages and faster career growth. An M.Tech from IIT suits those interested in technical expertise, research, or academia. Choose MBA for business-driven careers and M.Tech for deep domain specialization. Your career goal should guide your choice.

You need to explore the options that you have. First of all, you need to decide whether you want to do a job or go for higher studies. If you want to pursue Post Graduation then, you need to explore promising post graduation courses that offer a value addition to your career as well as help you land a great job with a decent salary. Well B.Tech is enough to get good job in engineering field but if you've M.Tech degree or MBA along with B.Tech then, it expands your career prospects. M.Tech is not the only the option after B.Tech but it is one of the best option in engineering courses especially for those who are willing to pursue higher
